oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Critical Velocity and Dissipation of an ultracold Bose-Fermi Counterflow
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Delehaye, Marion
Laurent, Sébastien
Ferrier-Barbut, Igor
Jin, Shuwei
Chevy, Frédéric
Salomon, Christophe
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Condensed Matter - Quantum Gases
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We study the dynamics of counterflowing bosonic and fermionic lithium atoms. First, by tuning the interaction strength we measure the critical velocity vc of the system in the BEC-BCS crossover in the low temperature regime and we compare it to the recent prediction of Castin et al., Comptes Rendus Physique, 16, 241 (2015). Second, raising the temperature of the mixture slightly above the superfluid transitions reveals an unexpected phase-locking of the oscillations of the clouds. We interpret this observation as resulting from a Zeno-like effect induced by dissipation.
